result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:56 PM Defendant Ashley Lynn Schinke in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Schraven in court for Ashley Lynn Schinke.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 21CF349 and 22CF28.
Atty Schraven heard on Deft's referral to Drug Court.
Requests the trial date be cancelled and a status conference be scheduled instead.
Court heard - Deft has not yet been accepted to the Drug Court Program but will like be staffed at the next Drug Court staffing meeting.
Deft understands.
All parties agree.
Court speaks to all parties to removing the jury trial date even if Deft is not accepted to the Drug Court program.
All parties agree.
Court removes the jury trial scheduled for Nov 16 and 17 from the Court's calendar in case 22CF28.
Court schedules with parties.

Court reviews the colloquy process and process moving forward with the deft.

Atty Hansen agrees.

Court grants motion.

Court grants motion.
DA heard on crime lab analyst.

12 jurors + 2 alternates + 5 strikes each = 24 jurors upfront.
Jurors to be brought up to the courtroom with the first 24 in order to be called to the jury box.

All parties understand and agree.

10:24 AM Defendant Ashley Lynn Schinke in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Ashley Lynn Schinke in custody.  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ashley Lynn Schinke appeared by video means with Attorney.
Court calls case. 
Copy of criminal complaint. 
Atty Hansen is being heard.
DA is being heard on bond recommendations- Request $10,000 cash bond.
Atty Hansen is being heard on bond.
Court imposes $5,000 cash bond, sign waiver of extradition, no possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid rx, no contact with C.W or B.C, no contact with known drug users or sellers and no possession of narcotic drugs.
